Author: urish
Content:

https://github.com/urish/tt-gf180-factory-test/actions/runs/17778063270

Author: mithro_
Content: @urish - Awesome work.

Author: algofoogle
Content: Great stuff  @urish ğŸ™‚ For fun I ran it on one of my old designs, and it worked: https://github.com/algofoogle/tt-gf180-toy/actions/runs/17800061560 -- I was surprised that the flow seems to define `USE_POWER_PINS` (and since my code was originally written to support Caravel, it's sensitive to those defines and gives a linter warning, though safe to ignore I guess).

Author: algofoogle
Content: I was thinking about using Magic's `plot` to render GDS instead of the existing renderer used by the TT actions. Maybe it will look better for IHP and GF's standard cells -- I will give it a try soon.

Author: urish
Content:
The verilog project template is ready!

https://github.com/TinyTapeout/ttgf-verilog-template/

One caveat: the "precheck" part will fail, and that's expected. We'll fix it over the next week or two.

Author: mithro_
Content: @urish - Should I promote that to people yet?

Author: urish
Content: Everyone should be able to use the template as-is right now, but we're thinking to only open submission for people who submitted to a Tiny Tapeout shuttle in the past (our past experience shows that this is a good way to get higher quality submissions)

Author: mithro_
Content: @urish - BTW Have you ever tested what happens if someone shorts VDD to GND together aggressively?

Author: mithro_
Content: @urish - The power gating should stop it from causing any problem.

Author: urish
Content: Yes, it should stop it.

Author: urish
Content: But the current shuttle won't be power gated

Author: h_thoreson_71412
Content: I did one past TT, kinda have been digging around Discord looking for ideas to work on for the next run. Is there anything I can try to do with this that would be helpful?

Author: urish
Content: Started a thread.

Author: 246tnt
Content: @Tim 'mithro' Ansell The power gate stops it as long as you don't enable that particular design ğŸ˜…   If you do enable it, you will get potentially damaging high currents.

Author: mithro_
Content: But have you actually tested such a thing?

Author: 246tnt
Content: No.

Author: 246tnt
Content: We had one design that had a short but it was through `li` in sky130 so it ended up drawing way more than expected and more than we recommend, but it was only ~ 15 mA which is still very much in the "chip will survive" zone.

Author: 246tnt
Content: I had a power gate test design that was meant to test high current usage in TT07 but I made a mistake in the layout so it wasn't able to generate very high current. There is a fixed version in TT08 but given I just got the chips yesterday, I'll wait a bit before trying to burn those ğŸ˜…

Author: urish
Content: We do have a way to mark dangerous projects post silicon, so users get warned before enabling them through the commander app

Author: algofoogle
Content: Will you be taking custom GDS on this run, or just digital LibreLane generated stuff?

Author: 246tnt
Content: Only LibreLane stuff. Without power gating it's a bit risky to accept random GDS ğŸ˜…

Author: urish
Content: If you manually add a power gate yourself we can consider including it

Author: urish
Content: Or if might just wait for the next shuttle

Author: algofoogle
Content: Yeah makes sense, I figured that would be the case. I think I will try an assortment of digital and analog/mixed stuff in GF180 and see whichever shuttles I can get onto, whenever ğŸ™‚

Author: mithro_
Content: BTW It's GF180MCU not GF180 ğŸ™‚ -- Going to keep saying that because if successful we'll end up with multiple GF180 technologies.

Author: urish
Content:
If you have previously submitted to any Tiny Tapeout shuttle (including TTSKY25b) and want to add your own project to this test shuttle:

1. Use this template: <https://github.com/TinyTapeout/ttgf-verilog-template>
2. Submit through this link: <https://app.tinytapeout.com/projects/create?shuttle=ttgf0p2>

This is a test shuttle, so there's a chance the silicon won't work, and it's likely that we won't ship the silicon to everyone who submitted a design.

Author: urish
